Package http.server

Class WebServer

java.lang.Object
http.server.WebServer
public class WebServer
extends java.lang.Object
Web Server TP Treat different HTTP requests. This version includes support for GET, POST, PUT, HEAD, DELETE requests and offers support for multiple file formats, including ico, png, jpg, mp3, mp4, avi and others This server is also capable of detecting different types of errors.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Stefan Ristovski Aydin Akaydin

    • start

      protected void start()
      WebServer constructor.

    • httpGET

      protected void httpGET​(java.io.BufferedOutputStream out, java.lang.String fileName)
      HTTP GET method. Opens a certain resource and sends it to the client.
      Parameters:
      out - to write to the client socket to send the resource to
      fileName - path of resource

    • httpPOST

      protected void httpPOST​(java.io.BufferedInputStream in, java.io.BufferedOutputStream out, java.lang.String fileName)
      HTTP POST method Add information to existing resource that is in the body of the request
      Parameters:
      in - Read on the client socket
      out - Writing on the client socket for the response
      fileName - File path of the resource

    • httpHEAD

      protected void httpHEAD​(java.io.BufferedInputStream in, java.io.BufferedOutputStream out, java.lang.String fileName)
      HTTP HEAD method Returns only the header of a GET request
      Parameters:
      in - Reading on the client socket
      out - Writing on the client socket for the response
      fileName - Path of file

    • httpPUT

      protected void httpPUT​(java.io.BufferedInputStream in, java.io.BufferedOutputStream out, java.lang.String fileName)
      HTTP PUT method Creates a resource with content given in the body of the request
      Parameters:
      in - Reading on the client socket
      out - Writing on the client socket for the response
      fileName - Path of new File

    • httpDELETE

      protected void httpDELETE​(java.io.BufferedOutputStream out, java.lang.String fileName)
      HTTP DELETE method Deletes a resource
      Parameters:
      out - Writing on the client socket for the response
      fileName - file path

    • createHeader

      protected java.lang.String createHeader​(java.lang.String status)
      Create a HTTP response without a body
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      Reponse

    • createHeader

      protected java.lang.String createHeader​(java.lang.String status, java.lang.String filename, long length)
      Create a HTTP response with a body
      Parameters:
      status - header code.
      filename - resource path included in the response body.
      length - Size in bytes of resource
      Returns:
      Response

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Start the application.
      Parameters:
      args - Command line parameters are not used.
